translated: By the power of former aspirations, the letter vaṃ completely transforms into a lotus in the center of which is a sun maṇḍala, upon which is a letter hūṃ. From that, a white club arises, and upon that is a sun maṇḍala marked with the letter hūṃ.

original: de las h'um yig gi 'od zer rnams kyis 'jig rten gsum bkang ste sems can mtha' dag gshin rje mthar byed kyi gzugs su byas nas h'um yig de la gzhug go //

translated: Light rays from that hūṃ fill the three worlds, and all sentient beings are transformed into the form of Yamāntaka. They enter the hūṃ.

original: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid gshin rje mthar byed sku mdog dmar po zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gsus pa 'phyang ba g-yon brkyang gi gom stabs kyis ma he la bzhugs pa /

translated: Later, in one's heart, on a variegated lotus and sun disk in the center, one should meditate on a white club arisen from the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, in the center of which is a red sun adorned with the syllable hūṃ.

translated: After that, below the navel of the Blessed Lady, on an eight-petaled red lotus, one should meditate on a red syllable hrīḥ, at the tip of which is a white channel.

original: thugs ka'i sa bon gyis nam mkha'i phyogs su spyan drangs ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams snga ma bzhin mchod la dbang bskur ba'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs ka'i sa bon gyis nam mkha'i phyogs su spyan drangs ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams snga ma bzhin mchod la dbang bskur ba'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having invited the Tathagatas with the seed syllable at the heart to the space region as before, one should make offerings and supplicate them for the sake of the empowerment.

original: aom aa bhi shinyca tu mam sarba ta th'a ga ta /
analyzed: aom aa bhi shinyca tu mam sarba ta th'a ga ta /

original: de dag gis dang rin po che la sogs pas spras pa'i gser gyi bum pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsis yongs su gang bas bdag la dbang bskur zhing gur gum dang me tog la sogs pa'i char dbab pa dang rnga bo che'i sgra la sogs pa yang bsgom
analyzed: de dag gis dang rin po che la sogs pas spras pa'i gser gyi bum pa ye shes kyi bdud rtsis yongs su gang bas bdag la dbang bskur zhing gur gum dang me tog la sogs pa'i char dbab pa dang rnga bo che'i sgra la sogs pa yang bsgom
translated: One should imagine that they confer the empowerment with golden vases filled with the water of gnosis, which are adorned with jewels, and so forth, and that a rain of saffron, flowers, and so forth falls, and that there is the sound of great kettledrums, and so forth.

original: par bya'o // slar yang rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis nam mkha'i phyogs su gshin rje mthar byed dmar po spyan drangs la /

translated: Again, one should invite red Yamantaka from the space region with light rays from the seed syllable at one's heart.

original: snga ma bzhin yang dag par mchod de dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pa 'dis dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin yang dag par mchod de dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pa 'dis dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du byas la /
translated: Having made offerings as before, one should summon, induct, bind, and control him with jham, hum, vam, and hoḥ.

translated: at the heart of the gnosis being abiding in the commitment being, one should recite the wrathful words as if mentally reciting.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /

original: thun gzhan la snga ma bzhin du sa bon dang phyag mtshan gyi rim pas bdag nyid bskyed la dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro bas ye shes sems dpa' gzhug par bya'o //

translated: In the other session, one should generate oneself by the stages of seed and insignia as before, and the gnosis being should be caused to enter preceded by the empowerment.

analyzed: nyal ba'i dus su stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor bsgom zhing nyal bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of going to sleep, one should go to sleep meditating on the yoga of emptiness.

original: dam tshig sngon du 'gro ba'i rim pa 'dis bsgom zhing bzlas na de'i gshin rje mthar byed dmar po 'di nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /

translated: If one meditates and recites with this stage preceded by the commitment, then this Red Yamantaka will certainly be accomplished.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'o //
translated: This is the word of the Bhagavat.

translated: However, here, in particular, one meditates on the form of white, yellow, red, and black, by way of the divisions of pacifying, increasing, controlling, and destroying.

original: gshin rje mthar byed dmar po'i sgrub thabs rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bi r'u pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed dmar po'i sgrub thabs rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bi r'u pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of red Yamântaka, composed by the lord of yogins, Virūpa, is complete.
